Topic.Title: The perfect contrarian indicators

Message.Msg: Not sure who is who on the SA bloggers you are citing, but I don't see a problem with owning both companies' stocks. I owned Intel at own point along with Nvidia. It's possible and not really betraying anything. I don't think these bloggers are just swing traders, one of them at least. Anyways, we'll what happens. I'm glad that any disappointment in Qualcomm's outlook can be a good bump for Nvidia and help us gain traction before the real news for Nvidia starts coming week to week . . guessing as early as mid-May, right after our ER and into the summer. Even Goldman Sachs is saying this year is unique for the market and one shouldn't 'sell in May and go away' this time. Whatever the motivation of the MMs now, it seems to bode well for us.

Topic.Title: Why Why Why the recent upsurge.

Message.Msg: This I agree with. Nvidia has a solid profitable business, large cash reserves, and is the leader in their primary business of GPUs. I think that Shield and Nvidia Grid each have a modest chance of being wildly, profitably successful, and the Tegra 4i looks like it's good enough and early enough to start taking smartphone market share. But all of those positive fundamentals were ignored or punished by the market. The recent upward price movement doesn't reflect any of those products gaining market traction. It's entirely big players making money from their ability to move the stock price. The price will drop just as suddenly when momentum investors start going long.

Topic.Title: Tegra could be taking marketshare from QCOM. Thats why its down AH.

Message.Msg: Tegra is a family of chips, not just one. We are now on the 4th generation part named Logan, and Logan's successor Parker has been demonstrated in a real time video. Do you bashers think Qualcomm can match this pace? Logan will have Kepler GPU with unified shaders and Parker will have stacked dram - you may want to read up on these features.

Topic.Title: Tegra could be taking marketshare from QCOM. Thats why its down AH.

Message.Msg: In addition to the fact that Parker SoC will incorporate Denver CPU which supports 64 bit memory interface.

Topic.Title: since besides me, ibey is so interested in brcm too: brcm up 7% now:

Message.Msg: brcm's mobile strategy is based on two thing: 1. first and foremost, there's no value added in just linking ARM cores (forget nvda,s graphic hypes, Tegra graphic has always lagged, still are not on unified cores whereas blah blah blah...). 2. brcm gets their added values through integrating their cheap radios for an integrated solution that lowers BOM costs and drastically speeds up the time to market. Point #1 has proven to be very true - anybody everybody making linking ARM cores, especially the leading two names in mobile. This is the undoing of the whole Tegra program. The market to high end bleeding edge ARM cores does not exist. As for point #2, the lower cost smart phone market is just opening up while the bleeding edge smart phone market is at best standing still. Hence aapl's woes. nvda's high end strategy's days came and gone without them getting a toehold in the market they targeted. And nvda does not have enough cheap radios for the huge, very huge lower priced smart phone markets. My guess is brcm is right and that in a year, when low priced smart phones are all the talk of the market, brcm will be shown a clear winner, spoken in the same breadth as qcom. brcm,s rise yesterday was really due to ramping their multiple wins 3G integrated solutions at Samsung. That is just a taste of things to come in about one year+. In a year, Jen will be extorting T5, T6 or whatever to an empty hall at wmc, barcellona, analysts day etc. etc., just like this year.

Message.Title: Yesterday's action and looking forward at today.
Message.Msg: Well, no one could be disappointed with yesterday's action unless he/she were short or calling for a "rangebound stock price". As I had mentioned, numerous times on this board, we would come in one day and the stock would jump and NOT retreat. Although the Bears DID try, several times, to sell into the rally, each time that selling was met with more buying. They did press harder in the last 1/2 hour, but I'm pretty sure most of them were frustrated that the stock closed at 6 month high on 40%+ higher than normal volume. One thing I found interesting was that there was not a large amount of volume in the options. But, with a 2 day move of over 6%, and no "news" that we've seen/heard, I'm thinking that someone either got inside info on when the Project Shield "coming out party" is going to happen, and/or the price of the device. Or, they knew that QCOM was going to lower guidance due to "competition" and when that word is used in that context, it says to me that people are now anticipating that Tegra 4i is about to be announced in several products, since the LTE modem is the place where QCOM has had NO competition up to his point. On that subject, Ibexx has already posted stories about several Chinese companies that are reportedly going to release phones with Tegra 4i in them, and maybe the market is wising-up to the reality of how big a market there is for NVDA to grow into. In any case, today will be truly interesting to see if the stock can continue this break out. I would expect to see SOME effort made by The Bears to break the stock back down, but looking at the charts, this is a CLEAR Break out, and the scrambling to cover those May 13s, 14s and maybe 15s (and those strikes in June, Sept, etc) will start in earnest IF the stock clears 13 1/2 with good volume and doesn't back off. One last thing directed at young Ashraf. I have to tell you I'm disappointed that you haven't acknowledged that "NEVER" came pretty darn quickly, and ARMH already won me my nickel.

Message.Title: Watch for a BIG "BLOCK" at 13.50
Message.Msg: So far, the Bears have not been able to muster any kind of real profit-taking. We did hit 13.50, earlier, and have made a few more attempts at 13.48-9, and now there's been a modest attempt to knock us back down. However, the volume is still pretty strong, and each time they knock it down another buyer steps in. This is a "tell", and the bigger one will be what happens if/when we get back to 13.49 bid. I would "guess" that there will be a BIG BLOCK, maybe 150-250k shares trying to keep the stock from going beyond that point. So, that is the next "battleground" area, and then somewhere in the 13.62-68 area, which was the intraday high area in October. Clearing that would open the path to a test of 14, and if we get another 10mm+ share day, I won't be surprised if we see that happen. The market is going MUCH higher than most people think, and with many of the semis, along with MSFT breaking out (the SMH hit another new high both yesterday and today) and the QQQs are almost there, too, we should clear 1600 in the S&P in the VERY near future. I tried to warn people that they should cover any calls from the 13 strike and above for May and beyond. I do hope a few of them took that suggestion. As always, we'll know in the fullness of time. Max

Topic.Title: Yesterday's action and looking forward at today.

Message.Msg: Hey Max, Nice summary thanks. I thought this was interesting from QCOM's report: "Revenues - Quarterly total revenue of $6,124 million was up 23.9% year over year. Segment wise, Qualcomm CDMA Technologies businesses contributed $3,916 million of revenues in the second quarter, up 28% over the prior-year quarter. Qualcomm Technology Licensing generated $2,057 million in revenues, up 19% year over year." Licensing is basically $0 cost, right? I mean there are some administrative costs, but those have to be close to zero I'd think. Then you get to the interesting part of the report: "Net Income - On a GAAP basis, quarterly net income from continuing operations was $1,866 million. . ." Licensing, a business with no costs, generated 2.05B for the Q. Yet the net for the entire business was 1.86B. In other words, every other business QCOM is in is under water. Everything else constant, licensing costs $190M than they brought in. Sounds to me like they are giving away their hardware. Not what I'd call a good long term business model.

Topic.Title: Yesterday's action and looking forward at today.

Message.Msg: Hey, Schmenkle... I was wondering about that myself, too. When companies have a near monopoly, as INTC almost has and QCOM has had in these arenas, they will often sell things BELOW cost to keep their market-share high. That's one of the issues that got INTC into anti-trust problems and court cases with AMD, and to some extent, NVDA. I do think that QCOM is doing just that, and once Tegra 4i is certified and starts showing up in products, QCOM's margins are going to be seriously pressured. Perhaps that's why the stock got hit so hard, today, while NVDA continued its 3 day climb to another new 6 month high. Volume was quite low in NVDA, today, but in QCOM it was 5 1/2 TIMES normal, and somehow the Bulls got it to close ONE PENNY above the 200DMA. It broke below EVERY major MA, and even with the last minute "buying" that got it back over that 200DMA, that may not keep it from going into a Bear Market. While anything can happen, and surely will, I do believe that the "tells" or signposts that I had seen developing a month or two ago, have come to pass and NVDA has finally broken out of its own long Bear Market and is headed MUCH higher. (And, YES, there WILL BE DOWN DAYS.) Whatever has precipitated this change in the "tenor" of how the stock is trading is open to debate, but from a "technical" standpoint, it's all systems go. I have no inside info, so I don't know if my speculation that someone has gotten wind of a release date party for Project Shield (and the price) is the catalyst or not. Or, perhaps it's just the technicals getting much better, or someone knows about some real design wins for Tegra 4i (as Ibexx has "reported" for some in China). Whatever the "reasons", I'm happy with the change we've seen and believe this stock will easily double, or more, over the next 1-3 years. And, as I said earlier, I'm a little stunned that young Ashraf has not admitted that "NEVER" came pretty darn quickly in ARMH. As always, we'll know in the fullness of time. Best, Max

Topic.Title: Yesterday's action and looking forward at today.

Message.Title: Been Reading The Nvidia Proxy Statement!
Message.Msg: It seems someone in management made a Foo Pah and stated the request for additional shares for employee options and RSUs wrong last year. Alas they have to do it again this year for management to get their ginormous compensation. It's proposal 2 and I just voted NO on a whole bunch of shares. Note: Options are OK in my book, but these ZERO basis RSUs are definitedly not shareholder friendly. In the proxy statement they promise to only issue 30 million new shares to employees in the next two years. Perhaps that is why they are buying back 60 to 70 million shares this fiscal year. Perfect timing. Read the proxy on Nvidia's website.....some of those numerous Senior VP's option are seriously underwater, and apparently becoming unhappy..

Message.Title: QCOM's margin pressure

Don't forget Tegra 5 is about 6 months away. Good luck to SA bloggers, who's article have been a clear trading signal in the opposite direction.

Topic.Title: QCOM's margin pressure

Message.Msg: Trending is not in Qualcomm's favor. Three things (at least 4) are going against QC's margins. --The deterioration of 3G connectivity chip (overtaken by MediaTek and some by Broadcom) --The steadily lowering average sales price of all its parts --The steadily lowering royalty rate --Competition catching up, and fast, in key areas. Qualcomm's recent "breakthrough" in LTE, claimed to overcome global geographical difference in spectrum requirements, really have no bearing on NVDIA's software defined Icera LTE radios.
